name: Experts Share Forecast at Annual Economic Roundtable
description: Economists, industry experts and business leaders from various sectors provided their thoughts on what 2022 will hold for the local, national and binational economy at the 38th Annual Economic Roundtable on Thursday.

affiliation.name: County of San Diego Communications Office

articleContent:
Economists, industry experts and business leaders from various sectors provided their thoughts on what 2022 will hold for the local, national and binational economy at the 38th Annual Economic Roundtable on Thursday.
This year’s speakers were:

Tim Keane, dean of Knauss School of Business, University of San Diego
Caroline Smith, director of Strategy and Intergovernmental Affairs, San Diego County
Jeff Light, publisher and editor, San Diego Union-Tribune
Peter Callstrom, president and CEO, San Diego Workforce Partnership
Jose Maria Barrero, assistant professor of finance, Instituto Tecnológico Autónomo de México (ITAM) Business School
Alan Gin, associate professor of economics, University of San Diego
Daniel Enemark, chief economist, Workforce Partnership
Kenia Zamarripa, executive director of international affairs, San Diego Regional Chamber of Commerce
Carlos Jaramillo, president, Tijuana EDC
Pedro Montejo, president, INDEX
Gustavo Lopez, senior associate, PolicyLink

The annual event was held virtually this year.
Presentations will be posted online.
